instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin, no chime, no image
threads.message:
Liquid damage on J6100 area.

Light on charger, no fan spin.
J6100 removed.
5V S5 was pulsing from 0V up to 5V every second.
There was short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> - <CAPACITOR>C7550</CAPACITOR> was bad.

After that got fan spin, no chime, no image/bkl, USB activity works, caps lock LED off, CPU warm.

There was no corrosion around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and diode mode reading are correct.
Just in case changed <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and got quarter fan spin.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin, no chime, no image
threads.message:
Check what happened to get quarter fan spin.
Start reballing SMC, once you've found corrosion not too far.
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin, no chime, no image
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6131</RESISTOR> on SPI line was bad - replaced and all works fine now.

Many thanks and have a great weekend :)
